required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Biological and Functional Changes in Healthy Smokers After Switching to THS 2.2 for 26 Weeks
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled, 2-arm Parallel Group, Multi-center Study, to Evaluate Biological and Functional Changes in Healthy Smokers Switching to Tobacco Heating System 2.2 (THS 2.2) Compared to Continuing Smoking Conventional Cigarettes for 26 Weeks in an Ambulatory Setting

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to demonstrate clinical, biological and functional health changes in smokers switching to the candidate modified risk tobacco product: Tobacco Heating System 2.2 (THS 2.2) as compared to smokers continuing smoking their conventional cigarettes (CC) over a 26-week period.
To characterize the study as successful, at least 5 clinical risk endpoints should move in the direction of smoking cessation and these results would be statistically significant. The main analysis will be defined a priori (using the Hailperin-Ruger approach) and will be made between THS 2.2 use and CC use as "per actual product used" and product use categories.

detailed_description.textblock:
The clinical, biological and functional endpoints to be measured in this study ("smoker's health profile") may characterize the modification of risk of smoking-related diseases.
Clinical risk endpoint to be assessed are selected based on a) their association to smoking-related diseases b) their association to smoking status, c) their reversibility upon smoking cessation, and d) their suitability to be measured with valid and robust methods in clinical studies.
The biological markers, functional markers and biomarkers of exposure (BoExp) with the strongest scientific evidence will constitute the 'smoker's health profile' and will be measured as the primary objective of the study.
Additional endpoints involved in the mechanistic of smoking-related diseases will be studied to provide additional scientific evidence to strengthen the primary objective.
The study will provide a perspective of product usage in a "real world setting" where smoking CC in addition to THS 2.2 may be expected.

primary_outcome.measure: Levels of High Density Lipoprotein C (HDL-C).
primary_outcome.description: Concentrations measured in serum. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.
Concentrations measured in blood. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

primary_outcome.measure: Post-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1).
primary_outcome.description: FEV1 post-bronchodilator and expressed as percentage predicted (FEV1 %pred). Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of Soluble Intercellular Adhesion Molecule 1 (sICAM-1).
primary_outcome.description: Concentrations measured in serum. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.
Concentrations measured in urine and expressed as concentration adjusted for creatinine. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.
Concentrations measured in urine and expressed as concentration adjusted for creatinine. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.
Concentrations measured in urine and expressed as concentration adjusted for creatinine. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline of Carboxyhemoglobin (COHb)
primary_outcome.description: Carboxyhemoglobin (COHb) is assayed from whole blood. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics. Expressed as % of saturation of hemoglobin.

intervention.description: Ad libitum use of THS 2.2 in an ambulatory setting for 26 weeks
Ad libitum use of CC in an ambulatory setting for 26 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current healthy smoker as judged by the Principal Investigator(s) or designee(s)
- Minimum age: 30 years old
- Have smoked for the last 10 years
- Have smoked more than 10 non menthol CC/day on average (no brand restriction) over the past year
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically relevant medical conditions that in the opinion of the investigators would jeopardize the safety of the participant.
- Subject who has (FEV1/FVC) < 0.7 and FEV1 < 80% predicted value at post-bronchodilator spirometry
- Subject with asthma condition (post-bronchodilator FEV1/FVC < 0.75 and reversibility in FEV1 ≥ 12% and > 200 mL from pre- to post-bronchodilator values)
- Subject who took or is taking concomitant medication which may have an impact on the "smoker's heath profile"
- Female subject is pregnant or breast feeding.
- Female subject who does not agree to use an acceptable method of effective contraception.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Following randomization of 984 subjects, from 1039 enrolled subjects, one clinical site was terminated from this study due to non-GCP compliance. The safety population of 1012 subjects included all enrolled subjects except 27 subjects from the terminated site.

group.title: THS 2.2 Group
group.description: Randomized to Ad libitum use of THS 2.2 in an ambulatory setting for 26 weeks

group.title: CC Group
group.description: Randomized to Ad libitum use of CC in an ambulatory setting for 26 weeks

group.title: THS 2.2 Use
group.description: ≥1 THS 2.2 or CC, and ≥70% THS 2.2 use over the analysis period, and ≥70% THS 2.2 use on >50% of days in the analysis period.

group.title: CC Use
group.description: ≥1 THS 2.2 or CC use, and <1% THS 2.2 use over the entire analysis period and <1% THS 2.2 use on ≥ 50% of days in the analysis period.

group.title: Dual Use
group.description: ≥ 1 THS 2.2 or CC and, 1% ≤THS 2.2 <70% over the analysis period, or THS 2.2-use and CC-use categories do not apply to 50% of these days.

group.title: Other Use
group.description: Subjects with missing product use data, subjects using e-cigarettes or other tobacco products, quitters, or subjects who switched across different use patterns between consecutive analysis periods.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Levels of High Density Lipoprotein C (HDL-C).
outcome.description: Concentrations measured in serum. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

group.title: THS 2.2 Use
group.description: ≥1 THS 2.2 or CC, and ≥70% THS 2.2 use over the analysis period, and ≥70% THS 2.2 use on >50% of days in the analysis period.

group.title: CC Use
group.description: ≥1 THS 2.2 or CC use, and <1% THS 2.2 use over the entire analysis period and <1% THS 2.2 use on ≥ 50% of days in the analysis period.

group.title: Dual Use
group.description: ≥ 1 THS 2.2 or CC and, 1% ≤THS 2.2 <70% over the analysis period, or THS 2.2-use and CC-use categories do not apply to 50% of these days.

group.title: Other Use
group.description: Subjects with missing product use data, subjects using e-cigarettes or other tobacco products, quitters, or subjects who switched across different use patterns between consecutive analysis periods.

measure.title: Levels of High Density Lipoprotein C (HDL-C).
measure.description: Concentrations measured in serum. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis will test if the mean level of HDL-C for THS-use is greater than for CC-use. The following hypothesis will be evaluated: H0: XTHS - XCC ≤ 0.0 HA: XTHS - XCC > 0.0 where XTHS and XCC are the adjusted means of THS-use and CC-use, respectively. H0 is rejected with a type I error α = 1.5625% (one-sided test).
analysis.method_desc: p-value less than 1.5625% would be considered statistically significant, following test multiplicity adjustment using the Hailperin-Rüger approach

outcome.title: Levels of White Blood Cells (WBC).
outcome.description: Concentrations measured in blood. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

group.title: THS 2.2 Use
group.description: ≥1 THS 2.2 or CC, and ≥70% THS 2.2 use over the analysis period, and ≥70% THS 2.2 use on >50% of days in the analysis period.

group.title: CC Use
group.description: ≥1 THS 2.2 or CC use, and <1% THS 2.2 use over the entire analysis period and <1% THS 2.2 use on ≥ 50% of days in the analysis period.

group.title: Dual Use
group.description: ≥ 1 THS 2.2 or CC and, 1% ≤THS 2.2 <70% over the analysis period, or THS 2.2-use and CC-use categories do not apply to 50% of these days.

group.title: Other Use
group.description: Subjects with missing product use data, subjects using e-cigarettes or other tobacco products, quitters, or subjects who switched across different use patterns between consecutive analysis periods.

measure.title: Levels of White Blood Cells (WBC).
measure.description: Concentrations measured in blood. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis will test if the mean level of WBC for THS-use is lower than for CC-use. The following hypothesis will be evaluated: H0: XTHS - XCC ≥ 0.0 HA: XTHS - XCC < 0.0 where XTHS and XCC are the adjusted means of THS-use and CC-use, respectively. H0 is rejected with a type I error α = 1.5625% (one-sided test).
analysis.method_desc: p-value less than 1.5625% would be considered statistically significant, following test multiplicity adjustment using the Hailperin-Rüger approach

outcome.description: FEV1 post-bronchodilator and expressed as percentage predicted (FEV1 %pred). Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

measure.title: Post-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1).
measure.description: FEV1 post-bronchodilator and expressed as percentage predicted (FEV1 %pred). Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis will test if the mean level of FEV1 for THS-use is greater than for CC-use. The following hypothesis will be evaluated: H0: XTHS - XCC ≤ 0.0 HA: XTHS - XCC > 0.0 where XTHS and XCC are the adjusted means of THS-use and CC-use, respectively. H0 is rejected with a type I error α = 1.5625% (one-sided test).
analysis.method_desc: p-value less than 1.5625% would be considered statistically significant, following test multiplicity adjustment using the Hailperin-Rüger approach

outcome.title: Concentrations of Soluble Intercellular Adhesion Molecule 1 (sICAM-1).
outcome.description: Concentrations measured in serum. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

group.title: THS 2.2 Use
group.description: ≥1 THS 2.2 or CC, and ≥70% THS 2.2 use over the analysis period, and ≥70% THS 2.2 use on >50% of days in the analysis period.

group.title: CC Use
group.description: ≥1 THS 2.2 or CC use, and <1% THS 2.2 use over the entire analysis period and <1% THS 2.2 use on ≥ 50% of days in the analysis period.

group.title: Dual Use
group.description: ≥ 1 THS 2.2 or CC and, 1% ≤THS 2.2 <70% over the analysis period, or THS 2.2-use and CC-use categories do not apply to 50% of these days.

group.title: Other Use
group.description: Subjects with missing product use data, subjects using e-cigarettes or other tobacco products, quitters, or subjects who switched across different use patterns between consecutive analysis periods.

measure.title: Concentrations of Soluble Intercellular Adhesion Molecule 1 (sICAM-1).
measure.description: Concentrations measured in serum. Geometric Least Squares means are provided as descriptive statistics.

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis of sICAM-1 will test if the mean level of this clinical risk endpoint for THS-use is lower relative to CC-use. The following hypothesis will be evaluated: H0: XTHS / XCC ≥ 1.0 HA: XTHS / XCC < 1.0 where XTHS and XCC are the adjusted geometrical means of THS-use and CC-use, respectively. H0 is rejected with a type I error α = 1.5625% (one-sided test).
analysis.method_desc: p-value less than 1.5625% would be considered statistically significant, following test multiplicity adjustment using the Hailperin-Rüger approach
analysis.estimate_desc: Derived as 1 – LS Mean Ratio (THS / CC)

reported_events.time_frame: The entire study duration per subject was between 32 to 38 weeks, including a Screening period of up to 42 days prior to enrollment, a 6 to 10-day run-in period prior to randomization, followed by a 26 week randomized exposure period. The end of study for a subject was defined as the check-out or the date of early termination of the subject plus the 28 day Safety Follow-up period, unless the subject was lost to follow-up.

group.title: THS 2.2 Group
group.description: Randomized to Ad libitum use of THS 2.2 in an ambulatory setting for 26 weeks

group.title: CC Group
group.description: Randomized to Ad libitum use of CC in an ambulatory setting for 26 weeks

group.title: Product Test
group.description: Enrolled subjects who participated in a product test, but were not randomized.

event.sub_title: Pyelonephritis acute, with Urosepsis and Nephrolithiasis

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Metastases to small intestine with anaemia
Adjustment disorder with depressed mood and bereavement

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: We confirm we have the contractual provisions in place which specify that in no event will the study site be allowed to disclose to any third party (or publicly release) any information obtained through the study without the CRO's prior written consent which in turn cannot provide such consent without Sponsor's approval unless such publication is made to satisfy regulatory requirements. The Intellectual Property rights and research results from the present study belong to the Sponsor.
